meanings.definition: To convert (a liquid) into a fine spray or mist.
meanings.sent1: I nebulise the medicine to make it easier to breathe.
meanings.sent2: The doctor will nebulise the saline solution for the patient's treatment.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, I nebulised water on my friend, making them think it was rain indoors.
meanings.sent4: The fog nebulised the landscape, creating a dreamy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The artist nebulised paint onto the canvas, creating a beautiful misty effect.

meanings.sent1: The nurse will nebulise the patient's lungs to help with their breathing.
meanings.sent2: It is important to nebulise the medication properly for effective treatment.
meanings.sent3: The superhero nebulised the antidote into the air to save the city from the toxic gas.
meanings.sent4: Her words nebulised comfort into his troubled mind, easing his worries.
meanings.sent5: The magician nebulised smoke around him, creating a mysterious aura on stage.
